item.title: Abandoning Music
item.description:
Ladies and Gentlemen it is with great pleasure to inform all of you that i have finally decided to get rid of all the music from my life.

My thoughts on Music

I Love music. It can be a great tool if you use it in your life just to entertain yourself once in a while and relax. But for me, the story is quite different, lets start with it.

item.title: Switched to Brave
item.description:
I switched to Brave Browser from Librewolf

Alright i have been making alot of switches these days, first it was switching to NvChad now this. I previously used Librewolf, which was a more privacy focused browser based on Firefox, and to be honest it worked quite well. It supported all the extensions/addons i needed, it had firefox sync, and the overall experience was nice.

One thing that was bugging me was performance, previously i was unaware that librewolf performed worse compared to other chromium based browser. I had to install a chromium based browser for my college work for some time, and there i experienced some speed, real speed. And i fell into the trap and now i am using a chromium based browser as my default browser. There are lots of things that i am missing from librewolf, such as smooth scrolling and mouse gestures (i miss them), its UI and firefox sync, but speed is something i always prioritize over anything else, so brave it is.

item.title: Switched to Nvchad
item.description:
I officially switched to NvChad

Throughout my journey of using Neovim, i always avoided using a pre-built config or any distribution of neovim such as LunarVim or AtroVim. I felt pride in building my own configuration. But, after spending countless amount of painful hours fixing things manually when some plugin decides to make some breaking changes out of nowhere. I finally decided i would just switch to a pre-built config like Lazyvim or NvChad.

item.title: My Experience With Dopamine Detox
item.description:
My Experience with Dopamine Detox

Few days ago i came to realize that from past few months i haven’t had any creative thoughts and i hadn’t done anything new at all. It was all the same, wake up, music, watch movies, videos on youtube, consume consume….. I would spend all my day just consuming information on the internet and not doing any real work. My mind was being stimulated entire day, whether it be with music or youtube videos. i wouldn’t spend a single moment of my day without any kind of stimulation. Sleeping? just play a long youtube video and fall asleep listening to it. Getting ready for college? just play a music playlist in the background. Working out? just play workout playlist. Reading or studying a article? play Lofi music in background. this had a big impact on my creativity and thinking. it was depressing, because when i was younger i was one of the most creative kids among other students in school, here i am being a coomer on the internet doing nothing but consuming online media. I decided to work on my lifestyle, and started dopamine detox, its been a week, and today i am going to share my experience with my dopamine detox.

item.title: Syncing keepass database between android and desktop with rsync
item.description:
Introduction to keepass

Everyone should use password managers, because remembering unique passwords is difficult. There are many great password FOSS password managers such as bitwarden, keepass, keepassxc etc. I wouldnt recommend using bitwarden because its cloud based, Your password database is being stored in cloud, and it makes me really paranoid. because there are thousands of users using it, so a lot of hackers trying to hack bitwarden’s server. bitwarden allows you to self-host it, so you can host it in your own server.

item.title: How to boot a computer without pressing power button
item.description: So recently, my computer’s power button stopped working. i dont know what exactly happened to it, but it just stopped working. now i was completely unable to boot my PC. i spent whole day without my computer, thinking i would take it to a computer technician and fix it the next day. but just for the sake of trying out, i tried figuring some way out myself. I opened my PC’s cabinate and searched for the cable which connects the motherboard and the power button(POWER SW cable). I disconnected that cable from the motherboard and took a screwdriver and then trouched it to the pins where the POWER SW cable was connected previously. Voilah! the pc booted up.
